current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Supporting the goals and ideals of American Education Week.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: )) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: supports the goals and ideals of American Education Week; and

encourages the people of the United States to observe American Education Week by reflecting on the
			 positive impact of all individuals who work together to educate children.

Whereas November 16 through November 22, 2014, marks
			 the 93rd annual observance of

Whereas people working in the field of public education, whether teachers, higher education faculty
			 and staff, paraeducators, custodians, substitute educators, bus drivers,
			 clerical workers, food service professionals, workers in skilled trades,
			 health and student service workers, security guards, technical employees,
			 or librarians, work tirelessly to serve children and communities
			 throughout the United States with care and professionalism; and

Whereas public schools are community linchpins, bringing together adults, children, educators,
			 volunteers, business leaders, and elected officials in a common
			 enterprise: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 591 IS: Supporting the goals and ideals of American Education Week.
